title: Julius Caesar: the rise of the Roman Empire
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Deneen
brief_description: The role of Julius Caesar in transforming Rome from a city Republic to a world empire; the arrest of power from the Senate by the triumvirate; Caesar’s military conquests culminating in his emergence as the single ruler of the Empire. He inaugurated reforms of the legal system, economy and public works. In 44 BC Julius Caesar was murdered.
